summary: An email from August 13, 2019, reporting an interview with an individual who worked at Jeffrey Epstein's private island in St. Thomas, US Virgin Islands. The worker states they saw Epstein twice but never witnessed any suspicious activity, younger females, or non-employees on the island.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The owner of the private island in St. Thomas, US Virgin Islands, where the interviewed individual worked. The worker reported seeing him twice.

events.title: Worker begins employment on Epstein's island
events.description: An individual started working at Jeffrey Epstein's private island in St. Thomas, US Virgin Islands.

events.title: Interview report emailed
events.description: An email was sent reporting the findings of an interview with a worker from Epstein's private island.

keyFacts: A worker was employed at Jeffrey Epstein's private island in St. Thomas, US Virgin Islands from April 2019 onward.
The worker reported seeing Jeffrey Epstein twice on the island but had no conversation with him.
The worker stated they never saw younger looking females, non-employees, or anything out of the ordinary on the island.
The worker did not know the names of other employees and never saw items being removed from the island.
This information was reported via email on August 13, 2019, likely as part of an investigation following Epstein's arrest.
